attributes.action: Cross-party public report to detail the full impact of a no-deal Brexit ASAP.
attributes.additional_details:
Voters not understanding impact of no-deal Brexit:
https://yougov.co.uk/topics/politics/articles-reports/2019/03/12/deal-no-deal-or-delay-what-public-thinks

Lack of warning of no-deal during Referendum:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-49165836

Gagging orders by Government concerning no-deal Brexit:
https://news.sky.com/story/brexit-hundreds-of-gagging-orders-taken-out-by-government-11671933

Experts decried by politicians:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-49203426
attributes.background: Data shows that UK voters have a very poor understanding of the impact of a no-deal Brexit, which was not explained during the Referendum. Experts are decried partisan by partisans. Gagging orders deliberately conceal the facts. An objective cross-party report seems very much in the public interest.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Parliamentary Select Committee, including the Exiting the EU Committee have produced a range of cross-party reports on the imapact of No Deal Brexit on the UK. You can find more information about the work of select committees at 

https://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
